questions.name: What does HIV stand for?
What are the modes of transmission of HIV?

choices.label: Unprotected physical relation with an HIV-infected person (unprotected without using a condom)
Using and sharing infected or contaminated needles/syringes/injections/blades
From HIV-positive mother to her baby during pregnancy and childbirth

questions.name: What is the main difference between HIV and AIDS?

choices.label: HIV is a virus, and AIDS is a condition that develops from the virus
AIDS is a virus, and HIV is a disease
HIV can be cured, but AIDS cannot
AIDS is the early stage of HIV infection

questions.name: HIV is NOT transmitted by

choices.label: having unprotected sex with infected person

questions.name: HIV is NOT transmitted through

choices.label: By shaking hands, hugging, sneezing, coughing

questions.name: To prevent HIV transmission, the following could be done

choices.label: Ensure that all blood transfusions are given only after HIV testing of the blood
To prevent Mother-to-child transmission, all pregnant women are tested for HIV, and if the mother is HIV positive, ART treatment is given to her during pregnancy
Stop sharing used needles and syringes

questions.name: In the school, an adolescent boy is HIV positive and his parents are also HIV positive. What do you think the school authorities should do? (Choose one correct answer)

choices.label: Suspend the adolescent boy from the school
Inform the boy's status to everyone
Assure the adolescent boy that his HIV status is kept confidential and ensure he continues his schooling
Arrange separate seating arrangements and tuition classes for him

questions.name: There is no cure for HIV but early diagnosis of HIV and starting HIV treatment (Anti-retroviral therapy - ART) can make a person live a long life.
Which of the following practices helps prevent mother-to-child transmission of HIV?
What is the purpose of antiretroviral therapy (ART) in HIV treatment?

choices.label: To manage and suppress the virus, improving the immune system
To replace the infected blood cells

data.name: E- Module on Metabolic Health (NCDs Prevention)

questions.name: What is metabolic health?

choices.label: The ability to eat anything without gaining weight.
How efficiently your body converts food into energy.

questions.name: What are the benefits of good metabolic health?

choices.label: Steady energy, poor immunity, and weight gain.
Steady energy, healthy weight, and strong immunity.
High blood sugar, high blood pressure, and obesity.
Fatigue, poor performance, and weak immunity.

questions.name: What is metabolic dysfunction?
What are some consequences of metabolic dysfunction?

choices.label: Fatigue, poor performance, and strong immunity.
Fatigue, poor performance, and weak immunity.
Steady energy, healthy weight, and strong immunity.

questions.name: How can you improve metabolic health?

choices.label: By eating more junk food and reducing exercise.
Through healthy eating, regular exercise, adequate sleep, and stress management.
By increasing screen time and substance abuse.
By ignoring BMI and waist circumference.

questions.name: What is the recommended amount of physical activity per day?
What is the Rainbow Plate concept?

choices.label: Filling your plate with junk food.
Filling your plate with junk food.
A balanced meal with fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and lean protein.

questions.name: What is BMI, and how is it calculated?

choices.label: BMI is calculated by weight divided by height squared, and it estimates body fat.
BMI is calculated by height divided by weight, and it measures muscle mass.
BMI is a direct measure of body fat.
BMI is irrelevant to metabolic health.

questions.name: Why is it important to limit JUNCS (Junk foods, Ultra-processed foods, etc.)?

choices.label: They contribute to obesity and poor metabolic health.
They are rich in essential nutrients.

questions.name: What is the recommended amount of sleep for maintaining good metabolic health?
What is the correct age to get married for girls and boys?

choices.label: For Girls 18 years and Boys 21 years
For Girls 15 years and Boys 18 years
For Girls 10 years and Boys 18 years

questions.name: What are the consequences of child marriages?

choices.label: Health Risks: Increased risk of maternal mortality, early pregnancies and complications during childbirth
Psychosocial Consequences, trauma, social isolation, and loss of freedom.
Interruption of Education: Child brides often drop out of school, limiting their future opportunities.
Cycle of Poverty: Child marriage often results in economic hardship and a lifetime of dependence.

questions.name: Why is it not easy to reduce early marriages in India?

choices.label: Girls & their mothers do not have the decision-making power
Belief that marriage at an early age protects girls from violence, rape
Children are not aware of the consequences of child marriages.
Parents are not aware of the consequences of child marriages.

questions.name: Which of these are the family factors leading to early marriages?

choices.label: Cultural and religious traditions of family
Protection of familys honor by early marriage.

questions.name: What roles and responsibilities a girl will have to take after marriage?
What are the consequences of teenage pregnancies?

choices.label: Complications for the teenage girl at the time of delivery
Anaemia and malnutrition for both mother and baby

questions.name: What complications do we seen in babies who are born to teenage mothers?
Which of the following is the child helpline number?
What laws protect children from child marriages, sexual offences and child labour?

choices.label: The Prohibition of Child Marriage Act
Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act (POCSO)
Child and adolescent labour (Prohibition and Regulation) Act

questions.name: The government of India launched the Bal Vivah Mukt Bharat campaign to raise awareness on the elimination of child marriages. A portal to increase awareness on child marriages, report child marriages, and obtain relevant resources and help is also initiated https://stopchildmarriage.wcd.gov.in/campaign.
International Children's Day is celebrated worldwide on..

The United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child is an important agreement by countries who have promised to protect childrens rights. India has signed the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child
Who is a child as per the Convention on the Rights of the Child?

choices.label: A child is any person under the age of 18
A child is any person under the age of 21
A child is any person under the age of 5.
A child is any person under the age of 2.

questions.name: Who are protected by child rights?

choices.label: Everyone under the age of 10 living in war
Everyone under the age of 15 living in poverty

questions.name: The Convention on the Rights of the Child comprises four main pillars -
Children who are naughty can lose their rights
Children who break the law should be____
As a child I have the right to give my opinion unless it harms other people
Which one is NOT a child right

choices.label: the right to learn about the child rights
the right to be protected from harmful drugs
the right to be protected from sexual exploitation and abuse
the right to say their opinion
the right to do what they want

questions.name: How many countries have ratified the Convention on the Rights of the Child?
What do you think NCD stands for ?
What does non-communicable mean?
What are some factors that can affect your risk of developing a noncommunicable disease
Which of the following are noncommunicable diseases?
What percentage of all deaths globally every year are due to non-communicable diseases?
Which noncommunicable diseases cause the most deaths?
What are some behaviours that can increase your risk of developing a noncommunicable disease?
How many deaths do you think are caused by unhealthy diets every year?
Can cancer risks be reduced?

choices.label: No cancers are genetic and you just get it no matter what you do
Yes, maintaining a healthy body weight can help you reduce your risk
Yes, by quitting smoking you can reduce your risk
Yes, it can be reduced by eating a healthy diet
Yes, you can reduce the risk by using sun protection measures.

questions.name: What is true about diabetes?

choices.label: You can totally prevent all types of diabetes
We know the cause of type 1 diabetes

questions.name: What does mental health truly mean?

choices.label: Being able to handle stress, work productively, and contribute to the community
A condition affecting only older adolescents

questions.name: Do you think anger management is part of developing emotional health?
Mishka always appears happy, even in tough situations. However, some friends notice she seems distant at times. What can we infer about her emotional health?

choices.label: She may be fine since emotional health isn't just about being happy; it involves emotional awareness and management, clear thinking, empathy for others, healthy relationship building, etc.
She may be facing some emotional struggles.
Both A and B are true, showing that constant happiness may not reflect emotional health.
Both A and C are true, showing that constant happiness may not reflect emotional health.

questions.name: Which scenario best reflects effective stress management during emotionally challenging situations?

choices.label: Taking on additional responsibilities without help
Engaging in practices such as deep breathing and time management to balance tasks
Ignoring the situation until it goes away

questions.name: If a friend is struggling with challenges in life, how should you support them?

choices.label: Encourage them to discuss their feelings openly and listen without judgment
Advise them to ignore their emotions and focus on work
Suggest they talk to others they trust
Offer unverified advice from the internet

questions.name: Nitya is going through therapy with a psychologist for some difficulties she is facing, but her peers make fun of her. What is the best course of action for Nitya?

choices.label: Ignore her peers and continue with therapy
Speak to her therapist and family about the issue
Report her peers to the school administration

questions.name: Which of the following daily practices can reduce the risk of developing mental health problems?

choices.label: Eating a balanced diet and getting enough sleep
Using social media to distract from stress

questions.name: What is the Tele-MANAS service in India (1800-599-0019 & 14416)?

choices.label: Toll-free number for mental health services

questions.name: Personal cleanliness and maintaining a clean environment are indicators of good mental health.

choices.label: Cleanliness and mental health are not related

questions.name: During an argument, Tony said some hurtful things to his mother. What would be the best way for him to address the situation?

choices.label: Discuss calmly and apologize, acknowledging her feelings.
Tell his mother she is wrong to feel upset.
Ignore it, believing she will forget what happened.
Move on without addressing the issue.

questions.name: Which of the following is a method of using drugs?
What type of dependence can be caused by substance abuse?
An adolescent should not develop which of the following habits?

choices.label: Saying 'no' to protect himself from the temptation to experiment with drugs
Seeking help and support from elders
Agreeing to experiment with drugs at least once
Staying away from social media and friends who encourage substance abuse

questions.name: What is drug addiction?

choices.label: Taking medicines with a valid prescription

questions.name: Which age group is most likely to get addicted to drugs?
Which of the following is not a symptom of mental illness?
Which of the following can help prevent substance abuse among adolescents?
Temporary physical and psychological symptoms that occur when the use of an addictive substance is discontinued is
What should you do if you or someone you know is struggling with substance abuse?

choices.label: Seek help from a trusted adult, counselor, or medical professional
Ignore it and hope it goes away

questions.name: Which of the following is a result of drug abuse or alcohol abuse?

choices.label: Coma and death due to failure of the heart
A combination of drugs and alcohol leads to overdosing and death

questions.name: What is Menstruation?

choices.label: It is the shedding of the lining of uterus and the remnants of the fertilized egg
It is the shedding of the lining of vagina and the remnants of unfertilized egg
It is the shedding of the lining of uterus and the remnants of unfertilized egg
It is the shedding of the lining of fallopian tube and the remnants of fertilized egg

questions.name: Which of the following is an incorrect menstrual hygiene practice?

choices.label: Wash the genital area after using the toilet/ after urinating
Keep the area between the legs wet so that it doesnt lead to soreness and chaffing
Use Cotton panties rather than synthetic ones

questions.name: Which of the following is incorrect?

choices.label: Menstruation is a normal biological process
Menstruation is not an obstacle to daily activities
There is no need to be ashamed of menstruation. We can talk about periods openly.

questions.name: Why is it important to consume iron-rich foods during menstruation?

choices.label: To replace the iron lost through menstrual blood

questions.name: What are the common signs of a healthy menstrual cycle?

choices.label: Regular cycles, minimal pain, and normal flow
Severe pain, heavy flow, and irregular cycles

questions.name: How often should you change a sanitary pad during menstruation?
What are the environmental-friendly menstrual products?

choices.label: Cloth pads, menstrual cups, biodegradable pads

questions.name: What dietary practices help in managing menstrual cramps?

choices.label: Eating fresh fruits and drinking plenty of water

questions.name: What are the health complications of poor menstrual hygiene?
What lifestyle changes can help maintain a healthy menstrual cycle?

choices.label: Frequent use of junk food and no physical activity

choices.label: Carrying oxygen to tissues and organs /

data.name: Promotion of safe use of Internet - Quiz (Teachers)
data.description:
SImple MCQ based format.

Select the most appropriate answer from the options provided in the question.

No negative marks,

questions.name: Fear of losing or not having a mobile phone or sleeping with the mobile phone is known as
Which of the below explains Phantom vibration syndrome

choices.label: Fear of losing or not having a mobile phone
Experiencing vibration of the phone even when it is not vibrating

questions.name: How can you make sure your child stays away from inappropriate content online?

choices.label: Ensure safe search online by using the app lock
Provide your child with your online passwords
Check your childs browsing history regularly

questions.name: How can you turn off app purchases online by children

choices.label: Remove credit card and any other personal details that you might have saved online
Do not use a credit card at all

questions.name: What should parents do if kids are becoming moody or withdrawn and do not connect with friends or family

choices.label: Keep a close watch on kids behaviour
Do not let kids go outside

questions.name: Which of the below sites should be monitored for the kids
Why should you not let kids use others devices?

choices.label: As kids can get access to the personal information of others
As kids like their devices more
Kids can get login details and credit card details of others

questions.name: If children understand the difference between the real and online world, they will be able to

choices.label: Examine information that is promoted through media
Distinguish between correct and false information

questions.name: The desire to constantly use the internet is a sign of internet addiction
Can parents actively work to ensure children stay safe from the harmful effects of digital technologies?

choices.label: No, that would be too difficult.
Yes, parents can monitor their childs behaviour and take steps to ensure that they do not get affected by the digital technologies negatively
No, things should be as they are.

data.name: Promotion of safe use of Internet - Quiz (Students)
data.description:
SImple MCQ based format.

Select the most appropriate answer from the options provided in the question.

No negative marks,

questions.name: Which of the below are not the symptoms of internet addiction?
Which of the following is not suitable for parents regarding kids safety?

choices.label: Having open discussions about kids digital habits
Not letting young kids make online purchases or use a credit card online
Staying connected with the school to gauge kids behaviour

questions.name: Which of the below comes under technical support for online safety

choices.label: Filtering out inappropriate content on social media apps
Turning off app purchases or the use of credit cards online by kids
Log out of all apps while giving devices to kids

questions.name: Which of the below doesnt come under hardware and software safety?
Which are symptoms of the internets impact on physical health?
Which of the below are the social impact of the overuse of digital technologies?

choices.label: Social anxiety, mood swings, and lack of confidence

questions.name: Which of these is not a psychological impact of overuse of the internet and digital technologies.

choices.label: Chances of getting brainwashed by outsiders

questions.name: Digital technologies are supposed to help us get ahead in life. However, some people use them to blackmail and cheat others. This is an example of
The psychological impact, including lack of self-esteem, lack of confidence, trust issues, and relationship issues, are an example of
What can we do to prevent our children from becoming subject to online fraud?

choices.label: Join politics to bring a change
Not engage with or talk to children
Talk to a doctor or a psychiatrist
Have open discussions with children about digital citizenship

questions.name: Which of the following are not the rules that children at school should follow to save them from the negative impact of digital technology?

choices.label: Follow school rules not carrying phones and devices
Follow the minimum age rule to join social media
Do not let children engage in conversation with strangers online

questions.name: What do you mean by having a trusting relationship with children

choices.label: Make sure the child knows he can talk to you as parents
Do not discuss anything with your kids
Do not let children meet with their friends

questions.name: Backache, headache, posture problems, and eye strain are a result of

choices.label: Spending too much time on digital devices

questions.name: A child is facing a loss of interest in real-world activities due to spending too much time online. Is this a symptom of internet addiction
What do you mean by FOMO in terms of digital technology?

choices.label: The constant fear of missing out when away from the internet

data.name: Reproductive Health and HIV prevention - Quiz (Teachers)
data.description:
SImple MCQ based format.

Select the most appropriate answer from the options provided in the question.

No negative marks,

questions.name: Antiretroviral therapy can reduce the chances of HIV transmission from an HIV -positive person to a susceptible partner by
People who are drug abusers are at higher risk of developing HIV

choices.label: Because drugs can affect the way people make decisions

questions.name: HIV destroys specific cells in the body, CD4 cells that are important in
How can HIV not be prevented?

choices.label: Using protective methods like condoms during sexual practices
Performing medical tests before planning a child

questions.name: How often should one get tested for HIV?

choices.label: You don't need to get tested for HIV unless you are at high risk.

questions.name: Which of the following is not a factor for people discontinuing their antiretroviral therapy?

choices.label: Lack of education on this topic
Discrimination against those living with HIV

questions.name: What does it mean to be HIV positive?

choices.label: It means that one has developed AIDS
It means that two tests have been identified as positive for HIV
It means that the virus cannot transmit to other people
It means that the virus will stop replicating

questions.name: Can HIV be managed?
How is the response to the treatment of HIV monitored?

choices.label: By asking the patient if he is feeling better

questions.name: What per cent of the Indian population is affected by sexually transmitted diseases?

data.name: Nutrition Health and Sanitation - Quiz (Teachers)
data.description:
SImple MCQ based format.

Select the most appropriate answer from the options provided in the question.

No negative marks,

questions.name: Below are the haemoglobin levels of four students in the 10th class. Among four, who is likely to be anaemic?
Meena has low haemoglobin levels. Which of the following foods will provide her with Iron?

choices.label: fish, egg, milk, cheese and paneer
red meat, beans, red kidney beans, chickpeas, nuts, dried fruits, and cereals
rice, chapati, roti and potato vegetables

questions.name:
What is the advised method to take Iron and
Folic Acid Supplementation?

choices.label: After the main meal of the day
Before the main meal of the day

questions.name: Jamal, a 15 yr old boy, is a kabaddi player in the school team. He likes rushing to food after playing without washing his hands. However, for the past few months complained of recurrent abdominal pains. In addition, he looks pale, lacks appetite, gets tired quickly and looks malnourished. What could be the cause?
Which of the following are national programmes for nutrition, sanitation and sanitation
National Deworming Day (NDD) is held on?
Construction of toilets, use of hand pumps for water, construction of drains, disposal of solid and liquid waste, and cleaning of roads are done under which scheme?
Open defecation can lead to which infection?
Which of the following is not a personal hygiene activity?

choices.label: Bathing and brushing twice a day
Brushing, bathing and wearing clean innerwear

questions.name: What is the right amount of consuming Oils, Ghee, Butter and sugars daily?

data.name: Nutrition Health and Sanitation - Quiz (Students)
data.description:
SImple MCQ based format.

Select the most appropriate answer from the options provided in the question.

No negative marks,

questions.name: Which of the following belongs to the root and tuber category?

choices.label: Potato, sweet potato, dahlia, carrot, sugar beet, and parsnip
Baby corn, bamboo shoots, beans (green, wax, Italian) and bean sprouts.
Spinach, Amaranth, kale, mustard greens, fenugreek greens, coriander greens

questions.name: Which of the following belongs to the category of carbohydrate and fat content?

choices.label: Salad dressings, mayonnaise, butter, candy, syrups, jams, and jellies
Wheat, barley, ragi, oats, bulger, quinoa, and wild rice

questions.name: Which nutrients are abundant in poultry, fish, and meat?
Which foods should a person eat for healing wounds?

choices.label: Blueberries, bananas, avocados, and citrus fruits

questions.name: The __________ should form half on a lunch plate, and the ________ should be less than 1/4th of the plate?
Paratha prepared wheat, jowar, ragi and multigrain flour forms which part of the food pyramid?

choices.label: In between the base and tip of the pyramid
Below the tip of the pyramid

questions.name: What is the right way to keep oral hygiene?

choices.label: Brushing teeth and flossing twice a week

questions.name: What includes personal hygiene?
What are the 7Cs to maintain food hygiene?

choices.label: Check, Clean, Cover, Avoid Cross-Contamination, Cook, Cool, and Consume
Check, Clean, Cold, Cross-Contamination, Cook, Contact and Consume
Clean, Cool, Cook, Cold, Chill, Cut, and Consume
Check, Care, Cover, Avoid Cross-Contamination, Cereals, Curry and Consume

questions.name: Which of the following does not come under 7 Cs for food hygiene to prevent contamination?

choices.label: Checking expiry dates before buying grain packets like maize, barley, ragi, bajra, wheat etc.
Cooking food in an iron utensil

Eating semi-cooked food stored at room temperature after
two days
Consuming cooked food stored in the refrigerator within 24 hours

questions.name: What is the right way of preventing Faecal oral transmission?

choices.label: Taking a bath, wearing clean clothes and using footwear while stepping out
Washing hands after using the washroom, eating cooked meals, covering food with a lid, and drinking boiled or filtered water.
Washing hands twice a day, bathing, and eating cooked but uncovered food
Eating well-cooked food kept in a covered container without washing hands

questions.name: What are the five Fs of faecal-oral route transmission that can cause infections?

choices.label: Faeces, flies, fields, fluids, and food
Flies, fields, fluids, fried and food
fingers, flies, fast food, fluids, and fields
Fingers, flies, fields, fluids, and food

questions.name: Ramesh is studying in 9th standard, feels sleepy during class, looks pale and gets tired with little physical activity. Which nutrient is he lacking?
Geeta is studying in 6th standard, and she falls sick frequently. Which factor could be the reason for her illness?

choices.label: She eats food that is kept open.
She eats food soon after reaching home without washing her hands.
She eats food that was cooked two days ago and kept outside.

questions.name: Vimla is studying in 8th standard; she looks pale, weak, and exhausted. She finds it difficult to concentrate in class. What could be the cause?

choices.label: Malnutrition due to lack of healthy food

data.name: Gender Equality - Quiz (Teachers)
data.description:
SImple MCQ based format.

Select the most appropriate answer from the options provided in the question.

No negative marks,

questions.name: Which of these is an instance of gender discrimination?

choices.label: Females eat after the males of the family.
Men are not allowed to cry when they are emotional.
Transgender people are not considered for important positions.

questions.name: Gender equality helps us

choices.label: Allows us to earn more money.

questions.name: Sara wanted a blue car, but her dad bought her a pink doll. Why did this happen?

choices.label: Sara's dad is right, and she should only play with dolls.
Sara does not know what she likes.
This is unintentional or intentional gender stereotyping.
The pink doll is a popular toy.

questions.name: Knitting, embroidery and stitching are hobbies enjoyed by -

choices.label: Any person can enjoy these as a hobby.

questions.name: How can we empower people who face gender discrimination

choices.label: Educate other people about transgender people.
To promote Awareness programs like 'Beti Bachao Beti padhao'.
Complaining against gender objectification In advertisements.

questions.name: Is this true? - Girls are emotionally more mature than boys!

choices.label: Not always. It depends from person to person.
Never, boys are always more mature.

questions.name: What is the gender pay gap?

choices.label: It is a type of jeans for different genders.
It is the sitting gap between 2 people.
It is the discrimination of payment for the same work between genders.

questions.name: Mohit is 23 years old and has nice hair. He wants to keep it long, but his mother is against it as it will make him look like a girl. What do you understand from this?

choices.label: Mohit can keep his hair as he likes.

questions.name: Who is a transgender person?

choices.label: A person who has no gender.
A person who wants to be a girl.
A person who has an expression and feeling of gender which is different from their sex(birth).

questions.name: Can we actively work to change the outlook of a society towards gender discrimination?

choices.label: No, that would be too difficult.
No, it's been there for centuries and is impossible.
Yes, it is a social construct, and we can influence a change through education and awareness.
No, things should be as they are.

data.name: Gender Equality - Quiz (Students)
data.description:
SImple MCQ based format.

Select the most appropriate answer from the options provided in the question.

No negative marks,

questions.name: A person's gender is associated with which of their attributes?

choices.label: The way they feel, behave and assert themselves.

questions.name: What is a patriarchal society?

choices.label: Societies in which the children are held in high esteem.
In societies where mothers were held in high regard.
Cultures where men are considered superior.

questions.name: Gender discrimination can happen in -
Which colour do you think girls like?

choices.label: Blue is the favourite colour of most girls.
Pink is the favourite colour of all girls.
Red is the colour of choice for most girls.

questions.name: Reeta was not given her promotion as she was five months pregnant. Was it the right thing to do?

choices.label: Yes, she will not be able to complete her duties.
Yes, she can try getting the promotion next year.

questions.name: Some girls in villages are not sent to school, but their brothers are. Why do you think that happens?

choices.label: Because the school is only for boys.
Because of the thinking that girls should only stay home and care for their families.
Because the schools are very far.

questions.name: Gender discrimination happens when a person is judged based on
Sushma was better at the presentation than Ali. So who should be given the first prize?

choices.label: Sushma, because she did a better job.
Ali, because he is a boy.

questions.name: It is not okay for fathers to take care of their children. Only the mothers can do that. Is this true or false?

choices.label: This statement is true because only moms can stay at home.
This statement is true because only moms love their children.
This statement is false as fathers are equally responsible for their kids.

questions.name: What can we do to educate people about gender equality?
The passing on of the family rights from father to son is a type of :
Consent in relationships is essential for
Confidence is a trait which can be seen in
A male teacher is allocated a class full of difficult boy students, is this gender discrimination?
What should you do if you face gender discrimination at work?

choices.label: Complain and work towards solving it.

data.name: Growing Up Healthy - Quiz (Teachers)
data.description:
SImple MCQ based format.

Select the most appropriate answer from the options provided in the question.

No negative marks,

questions.name: Which of the following statements is false?

choices.label: Concious about looks at this age is normal during adolescence.
Embracing who we are can help us transform into a better version of ourselves.
Accepting our bodies and appreciating our traits will boost our self-esteem.
Comparing ourselves with others regarding height looks, and skin colour helps us transform better.

questions.name: If an adolescent girl is not confident about his height, body shape and looks, What will you advise her?

choices.label: Take medications shown in Tv commercials
Focus on positive qualities and boost self-confidence.

questions.name: The appearance of acne before menses in girls is an indication of
Ankit and Abdul are best friends studying in 9th standard. However, in the past few months, Abdul has observed that Ankit is getting taller, like other boys in his class. What will you tell Abdul?

choices.label: He should try out some medications from the local store
Height growth occurs between 13- 17years in boys

questions.name: What must an adolescent do if he is experiencing challenges related to puberty?

choices.label: He should not discuss it with anyone.
He can seek the help of youth-friendly services to deal with challenges.
He must take medicines shown in commercials.

questions.name: Which of the following statements is true regarding physical changes in adolescence?

choices.label: Physical changes vary in each individual depending on hormones.
Physical changes appear at the same age in all boys.
Physical changes appear at the same age in all girls.

questions.name: Which behaviour should be encouraged among school kids towards others experiencing adolescent changes slower?
Which of the following does not come under Adolescent friendly health clinic?
Currently, how many Adolescent health-friendly clinics are functional in the nation?

data.name: Growing Up Healthy - Quiz (Students)
data.description:
SImple MCQ based format.

Select the most appropriate answer from the options provided in the question.

No negative marks,

questions.name: Adolescence is a phase of following changes

After residential schooling, Ramesh and Ajith, aged 13 to 14, returned to their village. They began raising awareness among residents of health, hygiene, and well-being to keep clean surroundings clean. Which characteristics of these adolescents lead them to take charge of enhancing cleanliness?

choices.label: Adventures, enjoyment, and the discovery of new possibilities.

questions.name: Amar is in 7th standard and enjoys experimenting with new things. He just caught a television commercial featuring a young child executing a high leap while riding a motorcycle. Ayush decided to copy it. Thankfully his mother stopped him at the right time. What causes this trait?

choices.label: Increased enthusiasm and spirit for adventure

questions.name: Parveen, Sunny, and Aliza are close friends who are 13 years old. Reena, Sunny, and Aliza had begun their periods in the past couple of months. Parveen has not got her menses. Should she be worried?

choices.label: Yes, she must immediately visit a gynaec doctor
She should try home remedies to start her periods
No, it is normal. Adolescent changes occur at different times for each person.

questions.name: His friends mock IX-grade kid Mohmmad for speaking like a girl's voice. Mohammad goes home and asks his mother if something is wrong with him. What Mohammad's mother should tell her son?

choices.label: There is some issue with him
Assure him that he will have masculine traits at the right time

questions.name: Which of the following statements is true regarding menstruation?

choices.label: Menstruation bleeding starts between 9-16 years. The monthly cycle length is 21-45 days, and the flow lasts for 3-7days.
Menstruation bleeding starts at 13 years. The monthly cycle length is 21-45 days, and the flow lasts for 3-7days.
Menstruation bleeding starts before 16 years. The monthly cycle length is 50-60 days, and the flow lasts ten days.
Menstruation bleeding starts after ten years. The monthly cycle length is 21-65 days, and the flow lasts for 7-15days.

questions.name: The girl who has not reached menarche at ______ years needs medical consultation?
The average age for menopause in women is
Albert is studying in standard IXth. He has been experiencing wet dreams. He feels disgusted and guilty and has low confidence due to this. What do you think?

choices.label: He is turning into a young man and has nothing to worry about.
He should visit the doctor immediately.
He should talk to his friends about this

questions.name: Rajani got her first menses. Since then, her grandmother has been imposing some restrictions on her. What should she do?

choices.label: Follow all these beliefs and should not question them.
Should not believe any of these myths and act rebellious.
Talk to her mom or teachers and make informed decisions.

questions.name: Radha and Ranjana are studying in 9th standard. They attained menarche ten months ago. Her family has decided to get married this year.

choices.label: No. Ranjana is still young and not entirely physically ready to bear a child.
Yes. As Ranjana has menses, she can be ready to have a child.
Yes. The beginning of menstruation indicates a girl is ready to have a child.
If Ranjanas family thinks it is correct, it may be right.

questions.name: Mihir is 14 years and having nocturnal emissions recently. He heard from his friend that wet dreams would cause weakness. Is it true?

choices.label: Wet dreams cause weakness in some young boys.
Wet dreams cause weakness in all adolescent boys.
No form of weakness occurs due to wet dreams.

questions.name: Is having a beard between 13-15 years is must for becoming a man?

choices.label: Facial hair depends on our genes and hormones; therefore, some males might not develop much body hair. It is normal.
Facial hair and beard, if these do not appear before 15 years, it is not normal.
Facial hair is a clear indication of manhood.

questions.name: Rajani, the 8th standard girl, is an extraordinary classical dancer. However, few of her classmates comment on her dark complexion. What should Rajani do?

choices.label: Bluntly give a back answer for rude comments.
Focus on dance practice and believe in her skills in her field of expertise.
Try expensive treatments to get fairer skin.

questions.name: Muzaffar is in 8th grade, he enjoys football, but he is never chosen by the coach for his school's squad due to his height and lean body. According to you, what should Muzaffar do?

choices.label: Try medicine from commercials to grow tall and build a body.
He just needs to focus on a healthy diet and his sports.
He should quit trying for the football team.
he should complain about the coach to higher authorities.

data.name: Vulnerability of Women and Adolescents to HIV
data.description: Being diagnosed with HIV does not mean a person will also be diagnosed with AIDS. Healthcare professionals diagnose AIDS only when immunity in HIV infected persons falls below a certain level or they begin to get severe opportunistic infections.

questions.name: All people with HIV have AIDS?

choices.label: Are all the following statements below are true or false?

questions.name: HIV is transmitted through touching, hugging or sharing food?
A person can get HIV infection by donating blood?

A person can get infected by HIV by sharing
needles with someone who has HIV?
It is impossible to protect oneself from becoming infected with HIV?
HIV is transmitted by mosquito bites or through other insects?
There is a cure for HIV and AIDS?
Having HIV infection is the same thing as having AIDS?
Many people who have HIV infection are not sick with AIDS?
If one member of a family has HIV, all other members will definitely have HIV.
HIV can be transmitted from a pregnant woman to her baby?
HIV positive students should be expelled from school as they may prove dangerous to other students and teachers sitting in the same classrooms.
In India, there is a law that protects the rights of HIV positive persons.
There is a helpline to access information about HIV, and related services.
A person can get tested for HIV in less than four weeks of undertaking risky behaviour to find out if they have HIV infection.
A person infected with HIV can lead a normal life.
